newsitem.title: USA: Cone Mills says three operations drag on Q3.
newsitem.headline: Cone Mills says three operations drag on Q3.

text.p: Cone Mills Corp said Tuesday that weak specialty sportswear and decorative print operations and worsening denim results were a drag on its third quarter operating results.

"Our third quarter operating results were very disappointing," company Chief Executive Patrick Danahy said in a statement. "The convergence of the traditional third quarter seasonal slowdown, weak specialty sportswear and home decorative print operations and deteriorating denim results has impacted sales and income."
Sales in the 1996 third quarter were $180.8 million with a net loss of $2.2 million, or $0.11 per share, after preferred dividends.
For the third quarter in 1995, sales -- including the sales of the Olympic Products Division, which was sold in early 1996 -- were $231.7 million with net income of $5.9 million, or $0.19 per share.
Excluding the sales of Olympic, third quarter 1995 sales were $208.2 million.
